conclusion: Analyze the U-I graphs for both the power source and the small light bulb.
The straight line (a) represents the power source.
The slope of this line gives the internal resistance of the power source.
The y-intercept of this line gives the electromotive force (emf) of the power source.
The curve (b) represents the small light bulb.
The curve shows how the voltage across the bulb changes with the current through it.
The operating point is where the two graphs intersect.
From the graph, the intersection occurs at U = 2 V and I = 2 A.
The output power of the power source is the power delivered to the light bulb.
Output power P_out = U × I = 2 V × 2 A = 4 W.
The total power of the power source is the product of the emf and the current.
From the graph, the emf (E) is 3 V (y-intercept of line a).
Total power P_total = E × I = 3 V × 2 A = 6 W.
The internal resistance r can be found from the slope of line a.
Slope = ΔU/ΔI = (3 V - 0 V)/(6 A - 0 A) = 0.5 Ω.
This confirms the internal resistance is consistent with the calculations.
The output power of the power source is 4 W.
The total power of the power source is 6 W.
